title: The top 20 agtech deals of 2023 - AgFunderNews
summary: The agtech industry saw a decline in mega-deals in 2023 compared to previous years, but investment shifted towards climate-focused solutions. This list highlights the top 20 agtech deals of the year, with companies focused on biorefineries, renewable fertilizers, carbon marketplaces, aquaculture management, and soil carbon sequestration.
greenwashing: The article does not provide evidence of greenwashing in the companies or innovations described.

title: Daybreak Dec. 11: Vilsack says US 'flipped the script for American agriculture' at COP meeting - Agri-Pulse
summary: The article discusses various agricultural topics, including the USDA's efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and carbon sequestration in agriculture, the FAO's roadmap to cut emissions from agrifood systems, the debate over whole milk in school lunches, and updates on the Dairy Margin Coverage program and the Ogallala Aquifer. It also highlights the Innovative FEED Act, which aims to streamline the FDA approval process for animal feed additives with potential environmental benefits.
product_or_process: Conservation practices and carbon sequestration quantification efforts

title: Kingspan launches hemp-based HemKor as part of its sustainability programme - RIBA Journal
summary: Kingspan, an insulation manufacturer, has launched three new hemp-based insulation products in Europe. The products, Jute Blend, Pure, and Padding, are made with a high percentage of bio-based materials, including hemp and recycled jute, and are designed to be more sustainable and environmentally friendly than traditional insulation materials.

title: Nexus Development Capital Adds Carbon Removal to Growing Portfolio with a $5M Investment in Maine-based ... - PR Newswire
summary: Nexus Development Capital has invested $5 million in Standard Biocarbon, a biochar producer, to scale up its operations. Standard Biocarbon produces high-quality biochar, a carbon-absorbing material, which has applications in soil remediation, stormwater management, and carbon capture. The investment aims to accelerate the production of biochar, a promising solution for combating climate change.

title: Mine land remediation drives demand for Hemp Farms Australia - Business News Australia
summary: Hemp Farms Australia (HFA) is capitalizing on the growing demand for industrial hemp, particularly in the US, where they are expanding their operations.  HFA's focus on developing dual-purpose hemp genetics allows for diverse revenue streams from a single crop, with applications ranging from construction materials like hempcrete and pallets to phytoremediation and biochar. This company is poised to dominate the Australian and US industrial hemp markets.
